properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 6 at 3:21AM MST until February 8 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...MAJOR SNOW STORM CONTINUES THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING FOR THE
MOUNTAINS...

...SNOW AND BLOWING SNOW RETURNS TO THE INTERSTATE 80 CORRIDOR
BETWEEN RAWLINS AND PINE BLUFFS LATER TODAY THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY
MORNING...

* WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations
of 2 to 5 inches expected, with locally higher amounts possible.

* WHERE...Laramie Valley. The heaviest snow is expected to fall
northwest of the city of Laramie.

* WHEN...From 2 PM this afternoon to 5 AM MST Saturday. The worst
conditions will occur from late tonight through mid day Friday.

* IMPACTS...Travel will be dangerous due to icy, snow covered
roads and periods of low visibility in falling and blowing snow.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 AM MST SATURDAY
